thread.title: Drunk passengers onboard Flybe plane removed by PoliceTravelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: Drunk passengers onboard Flybe plane removed by PoliceTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Drunk passengers onboard Flybe plane removed by PoliceTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Drunk passengers onboard Flybe plane removed by Police Published on : Monday, August 17, 2015
After the crew claimed some passengers were drunk, a plane due to take off at Newcastle Airport was boarded by Police. The Stansted-bound Flybe plane was delayed for about five hours due to the incident.
A Northumbria Force spokesman confirmed the incident saying they were ‘called by airport staff to help remove a group of drunk and disorderly passengers from a plane at Newcastle Airport.
Northumbria Police said four men were among a stag party.
No arrests have been made folwing the incident. However, a 30-year-old man was reported for an offence under the aviation act.
Flybe apologised for the delay, adding it had a “zero tolerance” approach to unruly behaviour on its flights.
“This resulted from the threatening and overly abusive behaviour exhibited towards the cabin crew immediately prior to departure, initially initiated by four members of a 13-strong stag party” clarified the airline.
